intro: Pneumonanthe vulgaris, commonly known as the common lungwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, velvety leaves that are often spotted with red or purple. The plant produces tall spikes of violet or blue flowers in the summer months. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist, shaded environments. Pneumonanthe vulgaris is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
